attributes.action: Rescue Paul and Rachel Chandler from captivity in Somalia
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Mr and Mrs Chandler were sailing on their British registered yacht in international waters. Under the UK Merchant Shipping Act (Registration of Ships) they are entitled to the protection of the Royal Navy. They were taken forcibly captive and have been held to ransom for many months now. We feel it is deplorable that, as bonafide UK citizens, we have abandoned them. It is a sad indictment on the state of affairs in our small nation that we can no longer offer protection to UK citizens.
It is telling that the Somalian population living within the UK are more active in trying to secure their release.
We would urge the Prime minster and his government to act to secure their release using any means necessary.
With regards
The Vardy family

rejection.details: This situation is very sensitive at the moment, so we are currently not accepting petitions on this matter.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
